data.title: TODO comment that will be saved to a 3rd party reminder service and will notify you later.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Linux Mint Sarah

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type "TODO" a pop up widget will appear. 
2. Login to a 3rd party service/app to save the "TODO" task. 
3. If logged in, set a reminder time
4. Get notified for the TODO task, with the name of the script where you put it.

data.title: Commands in Demo are not executing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: code-insiders 1.9.0
- OS Version: 10.11.6 (15G1212) El Capitan
- Source Materials: <http://code.visualstudio.com/blogs/2017/01/15/connect-nina-e2e#_deploying-your-app>  

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install azure cli preview with pip
2. run `az login`
3. run `az group create -n nina-demo -l westus`

This produces some sort of syntax error. I got it to work by running `az resource group create -n todo-demo -l westus`. I am guessing the demo is assuming that we have no resource groups created....

Update: Per [SO](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41531866/using-azure-cli-in-terminal-az-error-argument-for-appservice-plan), am I supposed to add the appservice component before running the az appservice command?
Any ideas? Thank you.

related to https://github.com/Azure/azure-cli/issues/1682

data.title: HTML Format does not work with attributes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:42:49.304Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a file with the extension html and open in code
2. Add the following lines:
```
<head>
    <meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=us-ascii">
</head>
<div class="datagrid">
    <table cellpadding="7">
        <col width="100" />
        <thead>
            <tr>
                <th colspan="9" style="text-align: center">Week 31, Monday 1 August 2016</th>
</tr>
....
```
3. The last tag in this example is not aligned correctly. Any tag with attributes is left aligned.

data.title: QuickEdit a settings icon does not switch to newline
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open 3-4 Editors(one of them is the default settings editor) next to each other to have not that much space left.
2. Try edit a option:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11234139/21748677/ca3e9bfe-d58a-11e6-8ebc-53e6f4f02fb2.png)

Since my screenshot program doesn't want to recognize my pointer, I've drawn it. If you want to edit this option, the scrollbar is in its way. And when I am over the scrollbar, the edit icon is invisible.
I would like to have it being switched to the next line, so I can edit this option, even when there is not much space.

data.title: Add API for win.isFocused(), win.isMinimized(), win.isVisible()

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be great to have an API exposed to extensions to see if the vscode is visible/focused/minimized (http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/browser-window/#winisvisible)

Extensions that continuously show some kind of information in UI can benefit from this because they will not need to do the work if the editor for whatever reason is not visible (example extensions: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=roblourens.vscode-stocks, 
https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=shyykoserhiy.vscode-spotify
)

data.title: Hide language modes without alias
data.body:
To implement #6461 I had to define an artificial language id representing the tags inside a JSX document. The language id is used for being able to associate the language configuration with the jsx block comment tokens.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/21745431/46adae48-d502-11e6-86b4-a2e817c44d75.png)

The jsx-tags language currently shows up in the language drop down. IMO it would be better if we hide all languages that don't only consist of an id but no alias.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/21745423/eaef5f5c-d501-11e6-9e61-7cd6e291264e.png)

data.title: Quick Open show the "..." to the left or center to not hide important segments
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insider latest
- OS Version: osx sierra

## Feature Idea
In the quick open window for searching by file names, it would be nice if the file path were below the file name, and  also if long paths had the ellipsis on the left of the line instead of the right. This is really a annoyance in my current project where most tests and files are under the same folder and the __tests__ dir is hidden by ellipsis
* /DetailsPage/index.js
* /DetailsPage/__tests__/index.js

## Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a workspace that has deeply nested paths
2. type `cmd+p` and start typing a file name
3. *err* When the path is longer than the quick-open window ellipsis are added to the right of the path.

## PR Feedback
I saw where in the code to correct the quick-open css. It also looks like the line-height for the items in the quick-open widget are set by JS to either 44px or 22px. But 44px is only triggered if the type implements getDescription(). I was going to add a getHeight method that the FileType could use to return 44px. And then use css to bump the path down to the next line.

Let me know if this would actually be merged if I submitted the PR 📟

data.title: Please add an ability to highlight any extra characters belonging to a word/variable
data.body:
Please add an ability to highlight (with an intent to copy) any extra characters belonging to a word on double click.

Example is say symbols in Ruby - `:user_name` the colon in front indicates it is a symbol, presently clicking on the `:user_name` word highlights only the `user_name` part which makes a user re-select it using the keyboard+arrow keys which is awkward and time consuming.

Apart from Ruby there are many other languages where special characters form a variable.

PS: I am aware of another editor I used [EMEditor ](https://www.emeditor.com/)which has this capability.

Steps to Reproduce:

3. I've got the message with the new feature "Hot save".

data.title: Ability to use regex or do operations in User Snippets
data.body:
Hi,
This is not a bug, but rather a feature request. I saw [here](https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/customization/userdefinedsnippets#_variables) that it's possible to use the filename within the snippets but what I need is to only use a part of it. For instance, I'd like to use the filename ResponsiveImage.jsx to automatically name the React Component as ResponsiveImage. Is this possible as of now or is it planned in any future releases?

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:42:49.304Z)

---

Steps to Reproduce:

hi,thans for vs code.but i meet some problems.

When I modify a lot of files, use the Save All function, all the changes to save the file, but will change all the files to the current document window, resulting in the current document confusion.
I can only 'back' document to correct, this is not cool oh ~ ~ look forward to solving.

当我修改了许多文件后，使用全部保存功能，的确全部改变的文件保存了，但是又会把所有改变的的文件保存到当前的文档窗口，导致当前的文档错乱。
我只能‘后退’文档，才能更正，这个不酷哦～～期待解决。
thanks .

data.title: VSCode NodeJS debugger is using wrong NodeJS Version for extension debugging
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.8.1
- OS Version:Windows 10 x64 and Kali Linux x64

Hey I am trying to make VSCode extension that uses nodehun module 
https://www.npmjs.com/package/nodehun 
which dynamically links hunspell library using node-gyp 
I have on windows 10: 

process.version = 7.4.0 
process.arch = x64

If I try to use nodehun methods manually using NodeJS command line interface everything works fine but if I try to use it in extension.js and debug via Visual Code I have:

process.version = 6.5.0
process.arch = ia32

That makes me encounter with error

Error: %1 is not a valid win32 application. 

I don't really understand how can VSCode use NodeJS version which I don't have installed.
Similarly on Kali linux x64 I have:

process.version = 7.4.0
process.arch = x64

and debugging extension via VSCode

process.version = 6.5.0
process.arch = x64

which at least have the same arch so I encounter with error

Error: Module version mismatch. Expected 50, got 51

this is really interesting because there is no node_module_version = 50, as you can see here on the nodejs website:

https://nodejs.org/en/download/releases/
there is only node_module_version 48 for versions 6.x.x and 51 for versions 7.x.x.

So I tried to rebuild with on windows 10 x64 
npm rebuild --target=6.5.0 --arch=ia32 and then debug via VSCode with error

Error: A dynamic link library (DLL) initialization routine failed. 

And on Kali linux x64
npm rebuild --target=6.5.0 and then debug

Error: Module version mismatch. Expected 50, got 48


I think there might be a trick in debug settings. My launch.json looks like this:

// A launch configuration that launches the extension inside a new window
```
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch Extension",
            "type": "extensionHost",
            "request": "launch",
            "runtimeExecutable": "${execPath}",
            "args": ["--extensionDevelopmentPath=${workspaceRoot}" ],
            "stopOnEntry": false
        },
        {
            "name": "Launch Tests",
            "type": "extensionHost",
            "request": "launch",
            "runtimeExecutable": "${execPath}",
            "args": ["--extensionDevelopmentPath=${workspaceRoot}", "--extensionTestsPath=${workspaceRoot}/test" ],
            "stopOnEntry": false
        }
    ]
}
```
How is it possible that VSCode debugger have different NodeJS version that I have installed and using node_module_version = 50?
Any suggestions or workaround how could I make it work?

data.title: Misspelled command names: Carret → Caret
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1

The user accessible commands `editor.action.moveCarretLeftAction` and `editor.action.moveCarretRightAction` are misspelled. They should use `Caret` instead. These files are affected:

- editor.all.ts
- carretOperations.ts
- moveCarretCommands.ts
- moveCarretCommands.test.ts

Maybe the old names need to be kept as deprecated in order to not break existing code.

data.title: Re use readonly #12732 #13863
data.body:
Reopen #13863 and will Solve #12732
* all in env (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L3379)
* rootPath in workspace (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L3870)
* textDocuments in workspace (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L3921)
are not. because they're using `export` and `namespace`.

Go to Definition does not work for Javascript object methods added dynamically.
Vscode unresponsive when updating npm dependencies(many)
data.body:
ps: usually the problem doesn't occur if the update is small. Meaning installing one or two packages.

After vscode becomes unresponsive, the only way to reload is to wait for the prompt or kill the vscode process.

- VSCode Version:
1.8.1
- OS Version:
Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

find a project with many dependencies.
Open vscode
install the dependencies while code is running

this freezes code and requires a reload after a while

data.title: [Feature-Request] Add another mode for "renderWhiteSpace" when selecting
